page.title: 10LIFE IN BARSBY
page.content: The 1701 spring well farm is the oldest building in Barsby. The first brick house, built with two inch bricks, was built in 1707. These bricks were all hand made. For many years sewage and waste water were allowed to drain along open dykes through the fields. The deepest well in Barsby was 35 feet deep. The most influential event in Barsby was the mechamisation of farm machinery at the end of the 19th century. This saw the beginning of a change in the style of local farming. Many of the small farms were bought out by the few wealthy farmers, creating large prosperous farms. field hedges and walls were pulled down to form large fields in which it was easier and more efficient for the use of machinery.
